column1: Meihekou (Chinese: 梅河口; pinyin: Méihékǒu; lit.: 'Plum River Mouth') is a city of 600
column3: People's Republic of China. It is a regional transport hub

column6: and 2 national highways. The city is also a major lorry transshipment point in the region as it is also the junction of two trunk roads

column1: Meihekou is located in southwestern Jilin province at latitudes 42° 08' to 43° 02' N and longitudes 125° 15' to 126° 03' E
column2: stretching 97 kilometres (60 mi) north−south and 35 kilometres (22 mi) west−east. It is situated in the western foothills of the Changbai Mountains and on the upper reaches of the Huifa River (辉发河). Bordering county-level divisions are Huinan County to the east
column3: Liuhe County to the south and southeast
column4: Qingyuan Manchu Autonomous County (Liaoning) to the southwest
column5: Dongfeng County to the west and northwest.

column1: Meihekou is a regional transport hub
column2: connecting the Shenji (Shenyang−Jilin City; 沈吉铁路)
column4: and the Meiji (Meihekou−Ji'an 梅集铁路) Railways. The highways that pass through the area are the Heida (Heihe−Dalian) Highway and the Jixi (Ji'an−Xilinhot) Highway.
